item.title: Todd add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Todd add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Todd add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Todd add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Todd add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Todd add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Todd add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Todd add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "If we find ourselves with a desire that nothing in this world can satisfy, the most probable explanation is that we were made for another world." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Todd add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Pain insists upon being attended to. God whispers to us in our pleasures, speaks in our consciences, but shouts in our pains. It is his megaphone to rouse a deaf world." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Todd add a quote by John Henry Newman
item.description: "I sought to hear the voice of God and climbed the topmost steeple, but God declared: "Go down again - I dwell among the people." -- John Henry Newman

item.title: Todd add a quote by C. S. Lewis
item.description: "He's not safe, but he's good (referring to Aslan, the Lion, in The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe)" -- C. S. Lewis

item.title: Todd add a quote by Blaise Pascal
item.description: "I made this [letter] very long, because I did not have the leisure to make it shorter." -- Blaise Pascal

item.title: Todd add a quote by Graham Greene
item.description: "You cannot conceive, nor can I, of the appalling strangeness of the mercy of God." -- Graham Greene

item.title: Todd add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "This above all: to thine own self be true, And it must follow, as the night the day, Thou canst not then be false to any man." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Todd add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "Definition of rock journalism: People who can't write, doing interviews with people who can't think, in order to prepare articles for people who can't read." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Todd add a quote by G. K. Chesterton
item.description: "Music with dinner is an insult both to the cook and the violinist." -- G. K. Chesterton

item.title: Todd add a quote by Carson McCullers
item.description: "Next to music, beer was best." -- Carson McCullers

item.title: Todd add a quote by Plato
item.description: "Musical innovation is full of danger to the State, for when modes of music change, the laws of the State always change with them." -- Plato

item.title: Todd add a quote by Johann Sebastian Bach
item.description: "Music is an agreeable harmony for the honor of God and the permissible delights of the soul." -- Johann Sebastian Bach

item.title: Todd add a quote by Martin Luther
item.description: "My heart, which is so full to overflowing, has often been solaced and refreshed by music when sick and weary." -- Martin Luther

item.title: Todd add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Truth is stranger than fiction, but it is because Fiction is obliged to stick to possibilities; Truth isn't." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Todd add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "O Romeo, Romeo, wherefore art thou Romeo? Deny thy father refuse thy name, thou art thyself thou not a montegue, what is montegue? tis nor hand nor foot nor any other part belonging to a man What is in a name? That which we call a rose by any other name would smell as sweet, So Romeo would were he not Romeo called retain such dear perfection to which he owes without that title, Romeo, Doth thy name! And for that name which is no part of thee, take all thyself." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Todd add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Men occasionally stumble over the truth, but most of them pick themselves up and hurry off as if nothing ever happened." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Todd add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "To see what is in front of oneâ€™s nose needs a constant struggle." -- George Orwell

item.title: Todd add a quote by Tom Bissell
item.description: "A great writer reveals the truth even when he or she does not wish to." -- Tom Bissell

item.title: Todd add a quote by Benjamin Disraeli
item.description: "When men are pure, laws are useless; when men are corrupt, laws are broken." -- Benjamin Disraeli

item.title: Todd add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Books serve to show a man that those original thoughts of his aren't very new after all." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Todd add a quote by David A. Karp
item.description: "Much of depression's pain arises out of the recognition that what might make one feel better--human connection-- seems impossible in the midst of a paralyzing episode of depression. It is rather like dying from thirst while looking at a glass of water just beyond one's reach " -- David A. Karp

item.title: Todd add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I don't know half of you half as well as I should like; and I like less than half of you half as well as you deserve." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Todd add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Deserves it! I daresay he does. Many that live deserve death. And some that die deserve life. Can you give it to them? Then do not be too eager to deal out death in judgement. For even the very wise cannot see all ends." -- J.R.R. Tolkien
